name: population health
description: Population health Involves the health outcomes of a group of people.

name: fiscal years
fiscal 2023
fiscal year
fiscal
FY23
Fiscal (FY) 2023:
fiscal year 2023
description: A fiscal year (FY) is the 12 months a business uses for financial and tax reporting. UChicago Medicine’s fiscal year 2023 is from July 1, 2022 to June 30, 2023.

name: trauma resiliency
description: Trauma Resiliency: Resilience is being able to adapt or change in the face of tragedy, trauma, danger, hardship, and ongoing stress in life. (Citation: Newman, R. (2005). APA’s resilience initiative. Professional Psychology: Research and Practice, 36(3), 227–229.)

name: low-acuity
low acuity
description: Low-acuity Acuity (or severity) is how urgently a patient needs help and the amount of resources needed to treat that patient. An acuity score is based on the Emergency Severity Index (ESI) triage tool. The tool gives a score of 1 for a high acuity patient for the most urgent (needs help first) and needs the most resources to treat. A score of 5 is low acuity, the least urgent and needs less resources to treat. (Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality, 2020)

name: An encounter
description: An encounter is each time a healthcare professional talked with or saw a patient.

name: Food insecurity
description: Food insecurity means having limited access to food because of social or financial issues.

name: low food access
description: Living more than one-half mile from the closest supermarket in an urban area.  Living more than 10 miles from the nearest supermarket in a rural area. (Source: US Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Economic Research Service)

name: Health Equity:
description: Health equity means everyone has a fair chance to be as healthy as possible. This means removing the things in our healthcare system that can exclude marginalized groups. Marginalized communities, peoples, or groups are those that are discriminated against and are excluded.

name: social determinants of health
Social Drivers of Health (SDOH):
Social Drivers of Health
social driver of health, also known as social determinant of health (SDOH)
SDOH
Social Drivers of Health (SDOH), also known as Social Determinants of Health
description: Social Drivers of Health (SDOH): Also known as social determinants of health. Things in a person’s life including where people are born, live, learn, work, play, worship, and age that affect health outcomes, risks and quality of life. (Citation: Office of Disease Prevention and Health Promotion. Healthy People 2030.)

name: Trauma-informed care
trauma-informed
description: Trauma-informed care is care that looks at and considers the effects of all of a person’s past and present life, including times of trauma.

name: Trauma resiliency:
description: Resilience is being able to adapt or change when you have tragedy, trauma, danger, hardship, and ongoing stress in life. (Citation: Newman, R. (2005). APA’s resilience initiative. Professional Psychology: Research and Practice, 36(3), 227–229.)

name: engaged
description: Engagement is the number of people who have contact with the Violence Recovery Program (VRP). This can be when going to the adult and pediatric emergency rooms for a Level I trauma, Level II and non-trauma events.

name: Medicaid and Medicare uncompensated care
description: Medicaid and Medicare uncompensated care: Support to make up for Medicaid and Medicare reimbursement rates that do not cover the cost of care. Medicaid is a joint federal and state program for those requiring financial assistance. Medicare is a federal health insurance program for people 65 and older and those with certain disabilities.

name: Unrecoverable patient debt
description: Unrecoverable patient debt: Amount absorbed when a hospital cannot collect expected payment for services.

name: Financial Assistance
Financial Assistance (Charity Care)
description: Financial Assistance (Charity Care): Cost of providing free or discounted services to qualified individuals.

name: Medical education
description: Medical education: Cost to teach and train future health care professionals not covered by tuition, grants or scholarships.

name: Medical research
description: Medical research: Funding to investigate ways to better prevent, detect and treat disease, as well as advance patient care.

name: Uncategorized community benefit
description: Uncategorized community benefits: Includes support for community health improvement programs and services.

name: Cash/in kind
description: Cash/in kind: Gifts to community groups for health-related activities.

name: encounters
description: An encounter is each time a healthcare professional talked with or saw a patient.

name: 80% of health outcomes
description: Medicaid’s Role in Addressing Social Determinants of Health. Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, February 19 Issue 5, Briefing Series.

name: South Side
description: South Side is defined as residents living in the following ZIP codes: 60609, 60615, 60617, 60619, 60620, 60621, 60628, 60633, 60636, 60637, 60643, 60649, 60653, 60655, 60827.

name: Ingalls Memorial service area
description: Ingalls Memorial service area includes a 13 ZIP code area in Thornton Township in South Suburbs. These 13 ZIP codes include: 60406, 60409, 60419, 60425, 60426, 60429, 60430, 60438, 60469, 60473, 60476, 60633, 60827.

name: fiscal 2023 University of Chicago Medical Center new hires.
description: Fiscal 2023 University of Chicago Medical Center new hires: employees who were hired between July 1, 2022 - June 30, 2023 who work at University of Chicago Medical Center (Hyde Park), UChicago Medicine off sites and Care Network

name: fiscal 2023 Ingalls Memorial new hires
description: Fiscal 2023 Ingalls Memorial new hires: employees who were hired between July 1, 2022 - June 30, 2023 who work at Ingalls Memorial and Ingalls affiliated off sites.

name: Nearly 40% of people
description: Citation: 2021 - 2022 University of Chicago Medical Center Community Health Needs Assessment.

name: morbidities
description: Having a disease or a symptom of a disease, often a disease that is chronic (long term).

name: hypertension
description: Having high blood pressure.

name: Online Teach Back CBT
Online Teach-Back CBT
description: Training (on the computer) to learn about the teach-back method.

name: teach-back method
description: Asking patients to say in their own words what a health provider has told them. This helps the provider know if they explained in a way the patient understands.

name: underinsured
description: A person who has insurance coverage, but not the amount needed to pay for all healthcare expenses.

name: dis-enfranchised
description: Not having the rights or privileges to fully take part in society, the community, or an organization, including being able to help set policies or to make one's voice (opinion) heard.

name: health disparities
disparities
description: Differences experienced by socially disadvantaged groups of people in healthcare, injury, violence, or opportunities to have the best health.

name: inequity
inequities
description: Not being fair. Unfair treatment.

description: Direction to Primacy: instead of a definition, this hover over can link to the section on the Microsite welcome page which explains the UCMC and Ingalls service areas.

description: Cash/in kind: Gifts to community groups for health-related activities.
